poem:
### September 5

Cameras blink, unsteady hands,  
caught between spectacle and grief,  
the breath of nations held—  
notes of triumph quieted,  
as darkness unfurls on the rings of five.  
Reporters weave words unscripted,  
the everlasting flame shivers.  
In the glare of the world,  
truth becomes the story,  
each frame a silent witness.
